author: Special Correspondent
text:
Violence broke out at Budwan University on Tuesday after students, mostly supporters of the Students Federation of India (SFI), the student wing of Communist Party of India (Marxist), forcibly entered the University premises and police resorted to baton charge to disperse them.

The SFI had organised a rally during the day and announced that its representatives would submit a deputation to Vice-Chancellor Smriti Kumar Sarkar. However, the University’s main gate was locked.

Students armed with sticks and rods broke the main entrance of the University. They also ransacked the University property.

Professor Sarkar said the administration was forced to call police and large number of people broke open the lock of the main gate of the university.

The authorities had to take the decision fearing attack on University staff, he added.

More than a dozen students were injured in the baton charge by the police, SFI district secretary Dipankar Dey. The SFI demanded resignation of the University authorities including the Vice-Chancellor over the incident.

Erroneous results

The SFI maintained that protests were organised over certain discrepancies in the results published by the University. Over the past few years, the publication of results has turned into protests by students.
title: SFI activists ransack Burdwan varsity
